intro: Cestichis clemensiae, commonly known as the Clemens's cestichis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters at the base of the foliage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
